back_cards.definition_en: The leader of a football team’s offense
back_cards.example_en: The quarterback threw a perfect pass.

back_cards.definition_en: A person directing a team’s strategy
back_cards.example_en: He acted as the quarterback for the project.
The quarterback led the team to victory.
The quarterback was the star of the game.

back_cards.definition_en: A central figure in a team effort
back_cards.example_en: She was the quarterback of the debate team.
The rocket launched into orbit.
The firework rocket lit up the sky.
The rocket carried a satellite.
Her career took off like a rocket.
The rocket hit the target accurately.
She spent hours in preparation for the exam.
The team’s preparation led to a great performance.
His preparation for the speech was thorough.

back_cards.definition_en: Materials or items ready for use
back_cards.example_en: The chef completed the meal preparation.
Her preparation for the marathon paid off.
The relative cost of the trip was low.
She visited her relative in the countryside.
The relative speed of the cars was similar.
His success is relative to his hard work.
The issue is relative to local policies.
She felt confident before the presentation.
He was confident in his coding skills.
Her confident smile won everyone over.
They were confident the plan would succeed.
His confident speech inspired the team.
The company made a strategic decision to expand.
Her strategic move won the chess game.
The military took a strategic position.
The strategic approach improved efficiency.
Their strategic marketing boosted sales.
Marine life thrives in coral reefs.
He joined the marine corps last year.
The marine ecosystem was studied closely.
Marine navigation requires precise tools.
The marine climate was cool and misty.

back_cards.definition_en: A company producing books or media
back_cards.example_en: The publisher released a new novel.
She works as a publisher for a magazine.
The publisher accepted her manuscript.
The publisher launched a digital platform.

back_cards.definition_en: A business in the publishing industry
back_cards.example_en: The publisher specialized in textbooks.
The company’s innovation changed the industry.
Her innovation streamlined the process.
The smartphone was a major innovation.
The innovation reduced energy costs.
Innovation drives progress in technology.
She highlighted the key points in the report.

back_cards.definition_en: To mark with a bright color
back_cards.example_en: He highlighted the text in yellow.
The speaker highlighted the need for change.
The event highlighted local artists.
The article highlighted her achievements.
She cracked the nut with a tool.
The mechanic tightened the nut on the bolt.
The recipe called for crushed nuts.

back_cards.definition_en: A slang term for an enthusiast
back_cards.example_en: He’s a nut for vintage cars.
She grabbed a handful of nuts.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who fights in combat
back_cards.example_en: The fighter trained for the boxing match.
The fighter jet flew over the base.
She’s a fighter against injustice.
The fighter won the martial arts tournament.
He’s a fighter who never gives up.
She holds the rank of captain.

back_cards.definition_en: A level of status or importance
back_cards.example_en: The officer rose to a high rank.
The soldiers stood in rank during the parade.
The movie earned a top rank.

back_cards.definition_en: A place in a ranking system
back_cards.example_en: His team is first in the league rank.

back_cards.definition_en: A form of energy from charged particles
back_cards.example_en: The house lost electricity during the storm.
Electricity runs the city’s lights.
The experiment explored electricity flow.
The bill for electricity was high.
The crowd felt the electricity of the concert.
This is an instance of his kindness.
In one instance, she forgot her lines.
The error occurred in only one instance.
For instance, he always arrives early.
This instance shows her dedication.
She inherited a fortune from her uncle.
He wished her good fortune in the game.
The business earned a fortune last year.
The fortune teller predicted her success.
His fortune grew with hard work.

back_cards.definition_en: To turn into ice or solidify
back_cards.example_en: The lake will freeze in winter.
She felt her fingers freeze in the snow.
He froze when he heard the noise.
They freeze vegetables for the winter.
The bank froze her account.
There was a variation in the test results.
The dish has a spicy variation.
The weather showed unusual variation.
The design has several color variations.

back_cards.definition_en: A shift in pattern or style
back_cards.example_en: The music included a variation in tempo.
The armed guard protected the bank.
The armed forces trained rigorously.
She was armed with facts for the debate.
The ship was heavily armed.
He was armed with confidence for the test.

back_cards.definition_en: To discuss to reach an agreement
back_cards.example_en: They negotiated a new contract.
She negotiated the tricky situation well.
He negotiated a lower price for the car.
The driver negotiated the sharp turn.
They negotiated to resolve the dispute.
Her laughter filled the room.
The joke caused loud laughter.
His story sparked laughter from the crowd.
The comedy show was full of laughter.
Their laughter echoed in the park.
Her wisdom guided the team’s decision.
He shared his wisdom about life.
The book is full of ancient wisdom.
Her wisdom helped solve the conflict.
The elder’s wisdom was respected.
The correspondent covered the election.
She was a regular correspondent with her friend.

back_cards.definition_en: A journalist in a specific area
back_cards.example_en: The war correspondent sent live updates.
He was her correspondent during the trip.
The correspondent interviewed the mayor.
The recipe calls for a mixture of spices.
The crowd was a mixture of locals and tourists.
Her music is a mixture of jazz and pop.

back_cards.definition_en: A mix in cooking or chemistry
back_cards.example_en: The mixture thickened in the pan.
The painting used a mixture of colors.
The assistant organized the meeting.

back_cards.definition_en: A support role in a job
back_cards.example_en: She works as a teaching assistant.
The chef’s assistant chopped vegetables.
The assistant answered phone calls.
His assistant handled the paperwork.
She retained her title as champion.
He retained the details of the lecture.
The company retained its top employees.

back_cards.definition_en: To keep in use or place
back_cards.example_en: They retained the old system for now.
She retained a lawyer for the case.
She sliced a tomato for the salad.
The sauce was made with fresh tomatoes.
He grew tomatoes in his backyard.

back_cards.definition_en: A food used in many dishes
back_cards.example_en: The pizza was topped with tomatoes.
She picked a ripe tomato from the vine.
She testified against the defendant.
He testified about the incident.
She testified to his good character.
The witness testified under oath.
He testified about his recovery journey.
Sugar is a key ingredient in the cake.
The ingredient for success is hard work.
She checked the ingredients on the label.
Trust is an ingredient in teamwork.
The soup needs one more ingredient.

back_cards.definition_en: A system of stars and planets
back_cards.example_en: The Milky Way is our galaxy.

back_cards.definition_en: A vast collection of celestial bodies
back_cards.example_en: The telescope revealed a distant galaxy.
Her mind was a galaxy of ideas.
The galaxy contains billions of stars.
Scientists studied the galaxy’s formation.
She qualified for the scholarship.
He qualified for the final round.
She qualified her statement with facts.
They qualified for the championship.
The course qualifies her to teach.
The company launched a new marketing scheme.
The villain’s scheme was uncovered.
The color scheme of the room was bright.
The pension scheme benefited workers.
Her study scheme improved her grades.

back_cards.definition_en: The Republican Party in the U.S.
back_cards.example_en: The GOP announced its new platform.
She supports the GOP in elections.
The GOP candidate spoke at the rally.
The GOP won several seats in Congress.
The GOP debated tax reforms.

back_cards.definition_en: A feeling of guilt or embarrassment
back_cards.example_en: She felt shame for forgetting the event.
The scandal was a shame to the company.
He hid his shame after the mistake.
It’s a shame to waste such talent.
Missing the party was a real shame.
She concentrated on her homework.
The troops concentrated near the border.
They concentrated the juice for storage.

back_cards.definition_en: To direct energy toward a task
back_cards.example_en: He concentrated on fixing the car.
She concentrated to solve the puzzle.
She entered a baking contest.
The contest had many talented participants.
The singing contest was televised.

back_cards.definition_en: A test of skill or ability
back_cards.example_en: The contest judged creativity and design.
He won first place in the contest.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of presenting something new
back_cards.example_en: The introduction of the product was a success.
The book’s introduction was engaging.
She made an introduction between her friends.
The course began with an introduction.
His introduction to coding was fun.
The fence marks the boundary of the property.

back_cards.definition_en: A limit of an area or subject
back_cards.example_en: Her research crosses the boundary of science.
The river forms a boundary between towns.
She set a boundary for her work hours.
The boundary dispute was resolved.
She squeezed toothpaste from the tube.
The lab used a tube for the experiment.
They watched a show on the tube.
The subway is called the tube in London.

back_cards.definition_en: A container for liquids or gels
back_cards.example_en: The artist used a tube of paint.
The game was Team A versus Team B.
The debate was science versus tradition.
The case was employee versus employer.
The match was Brazil versus Germany.
The lawsuit was Smith versus Jones.
The chef prepared a delicious meal.
The chef managed the restaurant’s menu.
The chef specialized in Italian cuisine.
The chef invented a new dessert.
The chef trained the kitchen staff.
She exercises regularly to stay fit.
He regularly checks his email.
The team meets regularly every Monday.
They regularly visit their grandparents.
The newspaper is published regularly.
The old building had an ugly design.
The argument turned into an ugly scene.
His ugly words upset the team.
The garden looked ugly after the storm.
The scandal revealed the ugly truth.
He tightened the screw in the chair.
The shelf was held up by a screw.

back_cards.definition_en: A slang term for a mistake
back_cards.example_en: The plan was a complete screw-up.
She lost the screw for the cabinet.
The machine needed a new screw.
She burned her tongue on hot soup.
He speaks his native tongue fluently.

back_cards.definition_en: A part of speech or expression
back_cards.example_en: Her sharp tongue upset her friend.
The tongue of his sneaker was worn.
The poet had a silver tongue.

back_cards.definition_en: Related to Palestine or its people
back_cards.example_en: The Palestinian culture was celebrated at the festival.
She studied Palestinian traditions.
The Palestinian artist showcased her work.
The book explores Palestinian heritage.

back_cards.definition_en: Of or from the Palestinian territories
back_cards.example_en: The Palestinian flag was raised.
The fiscal policy affected taxes.
The company reviewed its fiscal budget.
The fiscal year ended in December.
Fiscal responsibility was her priority.
The fiscal report showed growth.
The kids played by the creek.
The creek dried up in summer.
The creek ran through the forest.

back_cards.definition_en: A place for fishing or play
back_cards.example_en: They caught fish in the creek.
The bridge crossed the creek.

back_cards.definition_en: The part of the body below the waist
back_cards.example_en: She injured her hip while running.

back_cards.definition_en: A joint connecting leg and torso
back_cards.example_en: The doctor examined his hip.
The cafe is known for its hip vibe.
He carried the bag on his hip.
Her style is totally hip.
She accompanied her friend to the store.
The dish was accompanied by a salad.

back_cards.definition_en: To play music with a performer
back_cards.example_en: He accompanied the singer on piano.
They accompanied the group on the hike.
The book was accompanied by a guide.
